name: Introduction to Psychology
description: This course provides an introduction to the scientific study of behavior and mental processes. Topics will include research methods, biological bases of behavior, sensation and perception, learning, memory, cognition, personality, and social psychology.

name: Psychology Research Methods
description: This course covers the fundamentals of research design and data analysis in the field of psychology. Students will gain experience in selecting and using appropriate research methods, analyzing data, and interpreting results.

name: Developmental Psychology
description: This course examines the physical, cognitive, and psychosocial development of humans from conception through death. Topics may include prenatal development, infancy, childhood, adolescence, and adulthood.

name: Physiological Psychology
description: This course is an introduction to physiological psychology, which is the study of the biological basis of behavior. Topics include the structure and functioning of the nervous system, hormones, and genetics.

name: Health Psychology
description: This course surveys the psychological aspects of health and illness, examining the interrelation between psychological, physiological, and social factors that contribute to health and illness.
